answers.answer: Hi there!Stomach transplants are not done for gastroparesis or for any condition where it does not specifically involve transplantation of other GI related organs. However, gastroplasty is a procedure that may be tried in severe cases. Gastroplasty is a high risk procedure and may be associated with complication; hence the decision should be chosen wisely. It would be best to discuss the management plan with her treating gastroenterologist.Hope this is helpful.Take care!MH: Please move to Gastroentreology

question: our daughter has a stomach pacemaker , she has diabetes,she has an insulin pump.  she is 37 years old and  has diabetes for 16 years.She has also be told she has splondsis of the spine  Is there any help for her.  she weighs about 95 now.
title: looking to see if a stomach transplant would help her
